com.flowpowered.caustic.lwjgl.gl20

Class GL20Context

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flowpowered.caustic.api.Creatable
      • com.flowpowered.caustic.api.gl.Context
        • com.flowpowered.caustic.lwjgl.gl20.GL20Context
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GLVersioned
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GL21Context, GL30Context

    public class GL20Context
extends Context
    An OpenGL 2.0 implementation of Context.
    See Also:
    Context

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearCurrentBuffer()
      Clears the currently bound buffer (either a frame buffer, or the front (screen) buffer if none are bound).

      Returns the lowest OpenGL version required by this object's implementation.

      Returns the window height.

      Returns the window title.
      int getWindowWidth()
      Returns the window width.

      Returns true if an external process (such as the user) is requesting for the window to be closed.

      Creates a new frame buffer.

      Creates a new texture.

      Reads the current frame pixels and returns it as a byte buffer of the desired format.

      Sets the blending functions for the source and destination buffer at the index.

      Sets the renderer buffer clear color.

      Enables or disables writing into the depth buffer.

      Sets if the window can be re-sized.

      Sets the render view port, which is the dimensions and position of the frame inside the window.

      Sets the window size.
      void setWindowTitle(String title)
      Sets the window title to the desired one.
      void updateDisplay()
      Updates the display with the current front (screen) buffer.

      • setBlendingFunctions

        public void setBlendingFunctions(int bufferIndex,
                                 Context.BlendFunction source,
                                 Context.BlendFunction destination)
        Description copied from class: Context
        Sets the blending functions for the source and destination buffer at the index. Blending must be enabled with Context.enableCapability(com.flowpowered.caustic.api.gl.Context.Capability).

        Support for specifying the buffer index is only available in GL40.

        Specified by:
        setBlendingFunctions in class Context
        Parameters:
        bufferIndex - The index of the target buffer
        source - The source function
        destination - The destination function

      • setViewPort

        public void setViewPort(Rectangle viewPort)
        Description copied from class: Context

        Specified by:
        setViewPort in class Context
        Parameters:
        viewPort - The view port

      • readFrame

        public ByteBuffer readFrame(Rectangle size,
                            Texture.InternalFormat format)
        Description copied from class: Context
        Reads the current frame pixels and returns it as a byte buffer of the desired format. The size of the returned image data is the same as the current window dimensions.
        Specified by:
        readFrame in class Context
        Parameters:
        size - The size of the frame to read
        format - The image format to return
        Returns:
        The byte buffer containing the pixel data, according to the provided format

      • isWindowCloseRequested

        public boolean isWindowCloseRequested()
        Description copied from class: Context
        Returns true if an external process (such as the user) is requesting for the window to be closed. This value is reset once this method has been called.
        Specified by:
        isWindowCloseRequested in class Context
        Returns:
        Whether or not the window is being requested to close

      • getGLVersion

        public GLVersioned.GLVersion getGLVersion()
        Description copied from interface: GLVersioned
        Returns the lowest OpenGL version required by this object's implementation.
        Returns:
        The lowest required OpenGL version
